description: The SNMP trap that is generated when an alarm
entry crosses its rising threshold and generates
an event that is configured for sending SNMP
traps.

event.Summary: $v5, Alarm ID: $v7, AMO:$v9, ServiceAffecting: $v4, MO Class: $v8

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmActiveState ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgID u 9999 ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgNumber u 9999 ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgSeverity i 0 ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgServiceAffecting i 1 ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgDesc s EXAMPLE ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmStatusLastChange s EXAMPLE ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgExtNumber s EXAMPLE ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgConditionType s EXAMPLE ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgAMOType s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE

description: Unique value for each alarm. Its value ranges from 1 to
MAXINT (4 bytes).
variables.name: ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgID

description: Unique number that identifies this alarm. Assigned by the unit. The
alarm identifier is compose of 3 fields, the module number, the instance
number and the error number. The alarm number looks like this:
A.BBB.CC and is expressed in decimal, A is the module number, BBB is
the instance number (1-999) and CC is the error number (1-99). A module
number is assigned for each source of alarm in the system. For example
the port module is set to 1, the SFP module is set to 2, the PAA is set
to 3 and the environmental is set to 8.
variables.name: ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgNumber

description: Accedian Networks classifies alarms into four severity types. These types
and their associated decimal codes are, informational(0), minor(1)
major(2) and critical(3).
variables.name: ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgSeverity

description: This is to indicate if the alarm is service affecting or not. This
value depends on the utilization of the box. For instance in an
application where the monitoring of the traffic is mandatory the link
down event on the monitor port is service affecting.
variables.name: ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgServiceAffecting

description: This string is to describe the alarm in a readable way, e.g.:
+5Vdc Power supply fail.
variables.name: ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgDesc

description: This is the time of the last change for this alarm. A value of zero
means that nothing happened to this alarm since the last reboot.
variables.name: ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmStatusLastChange

description: Unique number that identifies this alarm. Assigned by the unit. The
alarm identifier is compose of 3 fields, the module number, the instance
number and the error number. The alarm number looks like this:
A.B.C and is expressed in decimal, A is the module number, B is
the instance number and C is the error number. A module number is
assigned for each source of alarm in the system (see Accedian
documentation for more detail).
variables.name: ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgExtNumber

description: This is the type of alarm condition.
variables.name: ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgConditionType

description: This is the Alarm Maintenance Object.
variables.name: ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgAMOType

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: The SNMP trap that is generated when an alarm
entry crosses its falling threshold and generates
an event that is configured for sending SNMP
traps.

event.Summary: $v5, Alarm ID: $v7, AMO:$v9, ServiceAffecting: $v4, MO Class: $v8

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmClearState ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgID u 9999 ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgNumber u 9999 ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgSeverity i 0 ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgServiceAffecting i 1 ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgDesc s EXAMPLE ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmStatusLastChange s EXAMPLE ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgExtNumber s EXAMPLE ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgConditionType s EXAMPLE ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgAMOType s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE

+5Vdc Power supply fail.
variables.name: ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgDesc

means that nothing happened to this alarm since the last reboot.
variables.name: ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmStatusLastChange

number and the error number. The alarm number looks like this:

variables.name: ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgExtNumber

description: This is the type of alarm condition.
variables.name: ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgConditionType

description: This is the Alarm Maintenance Object.
variables.name: ACD-ALARM-MIB::acdAlarmCfgAMOType

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName
